segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Generate security audits security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Generate security audits security policy setting.

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Generate security audits security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Generate security audits security policy setting.

segment.source: This policy setting determines which accounts can be used by a process to generate audit records in the security event log.
segment.target: This policy setting determines which accounts can be used by a process to generate audit records in the security event log.

segment.source: The Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (LSASS) writes events to the log.
segment.target: The Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (LSASS) writes events to the log.

segment.source: You can use the information in the security event log to trace unauthorized device access.
segment.target: You can use the information in the security event log to trace unauthorized device access.

segment.source: Because the audit log can potentially be an attack vector if an account is compromised, ensure that only the Local Service and Network Service accounts have the Generate security audits user right assigned to them.
segment.target: Because the audit log can potentially be an attack vector if an account is compromised, ensure that only the Local Service and Network Service accounts have the Generate security audits user right assigned to them.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesUser Rights Assignment
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesUser Rights Assignment

segment.source: By default, this setting is Local Service and Network Service on domain controllers and stand-alone servers.
segment.target: By default, this setting is Local Service and Network Service on domain controllers and stand-alone servers.

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values for the most recent supported versions of Windows.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values for the most recent supported versions of Windows.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features, tools, and guidance to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features, tools, and guidance to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: A restart of the computer is not required for this policy setting to be effective.
segment.target: A restart of the computer is not required for this policy setting to be effective.

segment.source: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.
segment.target: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.

segment.source: Misuse of this user right can result in the generation of many auditing events, potentially hiding evidence of an attack or causing a denial-of-service (DoS) if the Audit: Shut down system immediately if unable to log security audits security policy setting is enabled.
segment.target: Misuse of this user right can result in the generation of many auditing events, potentially hiding evidence of an attack or causing a denial-of-service (DoS) if the Audit: Shut down system immediately if unable to log security audits security policy setting is enabled.

segment.source: Settings are applied in the following order through a Group Policy Object (GPO), which will overwrite settings on the local computer at the next Group Policy update:
segment.target: Settings are applied in the following order through a Group Policy Object (GPO), which will overwrite settings on the local computer at the next Group Policy update:

segment.source: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.
segment.target: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: A malicious user could use accounts that can write to the Security log to fill that log with meaningless events.
segment.target: A malicious user could use accounts that can write to the Security log to fill that log with meaningless events.

segment.source: If the computer is configured to overwrite events as needed, malicious users could use this method to remove evidence of their unauthorized activities.
segment.target: If the computer is configured to overwrite events as needed, malicious users could use this method to remove evidence of their unauthorized activities.

segment.source: If the computer is configured to shut down when it is unable to write to the Security log, and it is not configured to automatically back up the log files, this method could be used to create a DoS condition.
segment.target: If the computer is configured to shut down when it is unable to write to the Security log, and it is not configured to automatically back up the log files, this method could be used to create a DoS condition.

segment.source: Ensure that only the Local Service and Network Service accounts have the Generate security audits user right assigned to them.
segment.target: Ensure that only the Local Service and Network Service accounts have the Generate security audits user right assigned to them.

segment.source: Restricting the Generate security audits user right to the Local Service and Network Service accounts is the default configuration.
segment.target: Restricting the Generate security audits user right to the Local Service and Network Service accounts is the default configuration.
